page.title: 05ROADS AND TRAFFIC
page.content:
Croughton is a long thin 'ribbon' village which developed along what is now the B4031. This was an ancient 'green lane', a drove road, and turnpike. It was part of the old coaching route from Banbury to Winslow. It is still part of an East/West route for drivers avoiding motorways, and consequently there is a high level of traffic through the village, increased to some extent by traffic for RAF Croughton. On Sundays the level is high as a very popular Sunday Market is held at Finmere, and when Grand Prix are held at Silverstone, there is an enormous increase.
Car Parking is a problem in the village centre, as the old cottages have little space or provision for garages.
